revised_title: Protein Concentrations in Aortic Interstitial Fluid and its Implications
tldr: The study examines the concentration of plasma proteins in interstitial fluid from human aortas and finds that the concentration of low-density lipoprotein (LDL) is significantly higher in the intima than in the patient's plasma. This finding raises questions about the function of arterial endothelium and the role of LDL in the development of atherosclerosis. The research also introduces a new method to collect interstitial fluid from intima or inner media for further analysis.
scientific_discipline: Biology and Life Sciences > Lipid Metabolism
